title: After playing Kindred on the PBE...
body: I went into a custom game with kindred to see how he(or she) worked. I really like kindred's mechanics and it is a really fun champion to play. However, I see a problem with the Q. I'm not sure if this was intended or not, but the damage from the q does not prioritize enemy champions over minions. I would sometimes get no damage off on the enemy because 3 minions would be closer to me. Maybe it is a tradeoff for having mobility with the Q. I'm not sure. I just wanted to bring this to attention in case it was not intended to be this way.

replies.body: It's intended that Kindred's Q does not automatically prioritize champions, we don't want to make the spell auto optimize itself each cast to that degree.  It will however prioritize the target of Kindred's last auto attack, so if there's a particular enemy you really want to hit you have the option of doing so.

Is it intentional that their skills, as well as other factors (heals) are non-scaling or have a very small scaling?
Is Kindred's Mark intended as their main source of damage output, and Q/W (and E as well) basically play off of that?

Also, why is the ulti so different than the rest of the kit? A large AoE antideath ulti is the last thing I'd expect on a hunter jungle marksman. It's not bad, It's just weird, and doesn't directly interact with the rest of the kit. :P

It's intended that Kindred will be reliant on Mark of the Kindred for a significant amount of their damage, later on in the game in particular.

The ult's there in part to give a baseline contribution that's independent of how farmed Kindred is or isn't. It's also a way of allowing a squishy, short ranged sustained damage dealer to take risks without that being a completely terrible idea. On top of that it's a way to distinguish Kindred from other moderately similar characters (farm junglers and other short ranged mobile ADCs). It also doubles down on the power within a specific area concept that the W also presents.

I see. So Kindred will specialize in shredding (in contrast to nuking) enemies, as well as high mobility, damage and utility, but in a very specific area (since Q is most efficient inside the Wolf's hunting grounds, and as you said stacking R on top of W at the right time has obvious benefits). :D

* I haven't tested them yet, but I really like the idea of having a tool which allows you to fight the enemy team even if they're ahead, as you have 4 seconds to bring them to 10%. After the ult ends, you're all at extremely low HP so you can outplay them from there, instead of having to deal with their superior stats _and _ having to outplay them.
[_**I have to note that I also love the thematic implication** -- the Lamb delays Death for 4 seconds, but Death inevitably comes and brings utter carnage immediately afterwards. The Lamb/Wolf, life/death interaction is simply ingenious, I can ponder on it for hours._]
* The mark + gank (or non-gank) strategy will surely give people heart attacks, the mindgames will be excruciating for both teams. <3
* Also I like how they have a relatively tank-busty identity that's however different from that of the other tankbusters such as Fiora, Yi or Yasuo.

I don't want to take advantage of your time here but it's the first time I get to speak with a Rioter directly-- so speaking of Yasuo, yesterday I created a [discussion](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/gNteWA6z-kindly-requesting-rioter-reply-does-riot-plan-to-make-any-changes-to-yasuo) about him and I would be grateful if a Rioter could put a moment of his time to read it and reply.
It got kind of buried under the Kindred "wow" and "ew" posts. Unfortunate timing :D
It would mean lot of I could get feedback on this :)

> The ult's there in part to give a baseline contribution that's independent of how farmed Kindred is or isn't.

Correct me if I'm wrong but doesn't %HP damage accomplish this already? She will increase in damage output based on how farmed the enemy tank is, not how farmed she is, ensuring a baseline contribution.
I don't really understand this. What if I'm teamfighting in a minion wave, and I'm only auto attacking one enemy? Then 2 of my arrows would be kind of wasted, no?

The first of the three arrows will fire at your auto attack target. The second and third arrows will fire at other targets based off their proximity to Kindred. If the target you recently auto attacked isn't in Q range the first arrow will also fire at a nearby enemy instead.

I was watching Pawnce play kindred on the pbe and he was under the impression that the wolf had to kill the camp in order to get the stack but he seemed unsure. Is this accurate or not?
It doesn't matter whether it's Lamb or Wolf that gets the killing blow on the camp.

Pawnce thought that because Wolf had used the line "don't steal from me" or something along those lines. That line plays when the enemy jungler/someone else kills the marked jungle camp before Kindred can get to it/steal it from Kindred.

It is not. Either of the two can get the kill on both champions and monsters, and you get the stack. 
For champions, assists grant you the stack too.

Kindred is supposed to be a jungle marksman, or at least that's what Riot implied here: [Champion Reveal: Kindred, the Eternal Hunters](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/page/champion-reveal-kindred-eternal-hunters) so I can only guess that Q+W is primarily for kiting jungle mobs, in which case target priority is pretty much meaningless on an AoE like this.

It could also be a case of Riot wanting to limit their free auto-targeted harass, much the same way that Ezreal's Arcane Shift specifically prioritizes minions and monsters over champions so that he doesn't get free harass and mobility.

My guess is that it is definitely intended.

Agreed. Arcane Shift targeting is purely positional. No favoring champions or non champions, afaik.
